DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure CD19 Antigen Result Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the percentage value for the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for CD19 antigen, a type I cell surface protein expressed on early B-cells that decreases the threshold for antigen receptor-dependent stimulation of B lymphocyte proliferation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for CD19 antigen, a type I cell surface protein expressed on early B-cells that decreases the threshold for antigen receptor-dependent stimulation of B lymphocyte proliferation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Expressed on early B-cells by human CD19 Gene (Ig Superfamily), 95-kDa CD19_Antigen is a type I cell surface protein with 2 extracellular IgC2 domains, a cytoplasmic tail with 9 conserved Tyr residues, and no significant homology with other known proteins. Assembled with BCR, CD19 decreases the threshold for antigen receptor-dependent stimulation of B lymphocyte proliferation and intersects with many intracellular signaling pathways. CD19 functions as an adaptor protein for Src family kinase amplification, crucial for antigen receptor-induced signal transduction. Following BCR/CD19 ligation, LYN (Src kinase) phosphorylates CD19-Y513, binds to the CD19-SH2 domain and phosphorylates CD19-Y482. CD19-pY482 recruits more LYN, leading to LYN phosphorylation and CD19-Y391 phosphorylation. CD19-pY391 recruits VAV, phosphorylated by LYN. (NCI):Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: B-lymphocyte antigen CD19 (556 aa, ~61 kDa) is encoded by the human CD19 gene. This protein is involved in enhancing B-cell receptor-dependent signaling.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a percentage for a hematologic laboratory value.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
